title: statham117
author: statham117
content: KD LITE 16.2T/1330WKD MAX 40.2T/3350WAnyone know about these two new machines?

comments.author: nullama
comments.body: Quote from: statham117 on June 09, 2022, 07:57:22 AMKD LITE 16.2T/1330WKD MAX 40.2T/3350WAnyone know about these two new machines?Those are altcoin miners(they don't mine Bitcoin, sha256), so you will probably get better replies in that section of the forum: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?board=160.0

comments.author: sxemini
comments.body: Quote from: statham117 on June 09, 2022, 07:57:22 AMKD LITE 16.2T/1330WKD MAX 40.2T/3350WAnyone know about these two new machines?These are Kadena miners. What do you want to know? It's an Asic and that's it. No sorry I forgot - too expensive as nearly any Goldshell Asic - you won't get your money back

comments.author: FP91G
comments.body: Quote from: statham117 on June 09, 2022, 07:57:22 AMKD LITE 16.2T/1330WKD MAX 40.2T/3350WAnyone know about these two new machines?These ASICs are very difficult to buy at a good price, so you may lose your investment if these ASICs are expensive to buy.For mining Kadena, only Goldshell makes ASICs and that's bad. Video cards based on this algorithm are not profitable and ASIC is useless for other coins.

comments.author: Coinfarm ventures
comments.body: The yield on almost every Goldshell ASIC sucks. I bought a KD-BOX for $4800 in March and it made $7/day of revenue. Now it makes 2 bucks if I am lucky, and is only worth $2300. That's a payback time of > 1000 days. I doubt these new models will be any different, especially since power cost doesn't matter for KDA mining.
